alert.note: Alert for Mason (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued January 21 at 3:39AM PST by NWS Seattle
info.description: .Rain combined with low elevation snow melt could push the Skokomish River in Mason county above flood stage late this afternoon through late Monday night. ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON THROUGH LATE MONDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall and low elevation snow melt is possible. * WHERE...A portion of northwest Washington, including the following county, Mason. * WHEN...From this afternoon through late Monday night. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Rain combined with low elevation snow melt could push the Skokomish River above flood stage late this afternoon through late Monday night. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
